changes_summary: These commits primarily focus on implementing and testing a free cuts popup feature across checkout and reactivation flows, along with calorie tracking adjustments and dashboard banner implementation for deactivated states. Several test migrations and API endpoint migrations were also completed as part of ongoing refactoring efforts.

features.name: Free Cuts Popup
features.description: Added hook and tests for displaying free cuts popup on checkout pages with interception logic for reactivation flow

features.name: Deactivated State Dashboard Banners
features.description: Implemented banners section for deactivated state on the Dashboard and integrated it into the page

features.name: Calories Tracking
features.description: Adjusted success/error tracking for calories feature

decisions.what: Migrate price endpoint in Reactivation banner
decisions.rationale: Part of ongoing API modernization effort

decisions.what: Move reschedule test to TPT test folder
Implement free cuts popup across multiple flows
decisions.rationale: Enhance user experience during checkout and reactivation processes

refactors.reason: Consolidate TPT-related tests into dedicated folder structure

entities.name: Checkout
entities.context: Enhanced with free cuts popup hook and tests

entities.name: Reactivation
entities.context: Added free cuts popup interception logic and migrated price endpoint

entities.name: Dashboard
entities.context: Integrated banners section for deactivated state (GD brand)

key_patterns: Feature development coordinated across multiple flows (checkout and reactivation)
Test-driven development with dedicated test implementations alongside features
Ticket-driven development with clear Jira references (GOC, TPT prefixes)
Component-based architecture with hooks for reusable logic
